items.title: How A.I. Is Helping Architects Change Workplace Design
items.abstract: With more hybrid workers and new office needs, firms like Zaha Hadid Architects are turning to artificial intelligence for solutions.

items.title: Cities vs. Rising Seas
items.abstract: Around the world, tens of millions could lose their homes in the coming decades. Planning is the key to protecting them.

items.title: Fred Siegel, Urban Historian and a Former Liberal, Is Dead at 78
items.abstract: His books traced his ideological transformation from a Democratic Socialist in New York to neoconservative partisan for Rudolph Giuliani and Donald Trump.

items.title: Let the Postpandemic City Grow Wild
items.abstract: Cities contain too many perfected, simplified forms of nature, ones that look pretty but are biologically impoverished.

items.title: An Architect Known for Building Castles in the ‘Vegetable Kingdom’
items.abstract: A man of many hats, Emilio Ambasz practiced green architecture long before it was fashionable.
